articles.content:
Mongolian Organizations' Appeal Responded to in Peru 
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship in a statement on March 18 fully supported the proposal of Mongolian organizations to hold a grand meeting in praise of the exploits performed by the three generals of Mt.Paektu in the area of the secret camp of Mt. Paektu in 2005 and build a monument to their greatness there.
 The statement noted that the institute expressed particular reverence and respect to President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Suk,anti-Japanese war hero, and leader Kim Jong Il.    
The institute voices support and solidarity with the Songun policy of the DPRK and the June 15 North-south Joint Declaration which ensure peace, the statement added.

Japan Warned against Its Moves for Reinvasion of Korea
articles.content:
Japan Warned against Its Moves for Reinvasion of Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- If Japan, oblivious of the lesson of history, launches reinvasion of Korea, toeing the line of the United States, the youth and students of Korea will courageously turn out in a sacred battle for revenge with arms reflecting the spirit of Mt. Paektu in hands and wipe out the hateful Japanese reactionaries at a single blow and thus give vent to the pent-up resentment of the Koreans. A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League said this in a statement on March 25 40 years after the March 24 campaign against the criminal "talks" between south Korea and Japan held in south Korea under the back-stage wirepulling of the United States.
 The March 24 campaign was a just anti-imperialist patriotic struggle that fully demonstrated the nation's patriotic will and indomitable fighting spirit not to tolerate the Japanese militarists' moves for reinvasion and the sycophantic and treacherous forces' vicious anti-national behavior but to defend the dignity and sovereignty of the nation, he noted.    
 He expressed belief that the south Korean youth and students would carry on their powerful anti-U.S. and anti-Japan resistance to foil foreign forces' moves for domination, interference, aggression and war and build a peaceful and prosperous reunified country with the same spirit and mettle as they displayed in their struggle to protect the national dignity and sovereignty 40 years ago.

Degree of Doctor of Linguistics Awarded to Chinese Correspondent in DPRK
articles.content:
Degree of Doctor of Linguistics Awarded to Chinese Correspondent in DPRK
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Zhao Jiaming, chief correspondent of the Bureau of the Chinese People's Daily in Pyongyang, was awarded the degree of doctor of linguistics of the DPRK for having made a great contribution to the improvement of the translation level and skill by systematizing the grammatical study of the Korean-Chinese contrastive translation.
 An awarding ceremony was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday. The decision of the State Commission for Conferring Degrees and Titles of the DPRK was read out and a certificate and medal for the degree of doctor of linguistics were awarded to him.    
 Present there were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kwak Pom Gi who is chairman of the State Commission for Conferring Degrees and Titles of the DPRK, Secretary General of the commission Kang Chun Gum, Vice-Editor of Rodong Sinmun Hong Hwang Gi and other officials concerned, Chinese Ambassador E.P. to the DPRK Wu Donghe and staff members of the embassy.
